summary_md:
Round recap: Developed a “hybrid” plateau-averaging lemma that combines both MRS branches to give explicit, checkable plateau averages. For a factor-2 plateau I=[m,m+L) the authors show
E_{k∈I} E_++[ALG_k/OPT_k] ≤ 2·C_bi·min{Ā,B̄} + C_fix(ln m + O(1))/L,
with Ā = 2 + 1/(2e) + ln(2m) − ln((L−1)!)/(L−1) (≤ 3 + 1/(2e) + ln(2m/(L−1))) and
B̄ = 1 + (2 + 1/(2e) + ln(2m))/(L−1) + (m/(e(L−1)))·H_{L−2}.
This yields a two‑regime consolidation (logarithmic branch vs. large‑Δ branch) giving O(1) in both natural regimes, an explicit plateau quantile/probability bound (convertible via Markov; e.g. L ≥ 101·m gives ≈98% on that plateau), and a strengthened global decomposition summing per‑plateau min terms. Also advanced a micro‑lemma toward heavy‑coverage: expected heavy collisions ≤ O(k1/R) under scale separation R ≥ k^C. Verifier: partial success. Cited: prover-02.out.json.
highlights: Hybrid plateau-average lemma: explicit Ā and B̄ formulas and the bound E_{k∈I}E_++[ALG_k/OPT_k] ≤ 2·C_bi·min{Ā,B̄} + endpoint term C_fix(ln m+O(1))/L.
Two‑regime consolidation: the plateau average is K0 + K1·min{ ln^+(2m/(L−1)), (m ln L)/L } + K2·(ln m)/L, so either branch yields O(1) depending on L vs. m.

Quantile/probability guarantee: for threshold T, at least (L−T+1)/(L−1) of k satisfy E_++ ≤ 2·C_bi(1 + m/(e(T−1))); Markov yields a joint (k,seeding) probability conversion (numerical example: L ≥ 101·m ⇒ ≈98% on plateau, implying ≈1% global if plateau occupies ≈2% of [k0,2k0)).
Global decomposition strengthened: replacing the purely log-based plateau average with the hybrid min-term improves the global average when some plateaus are long (captures (m ln L)/L regime).

Micro‑lemma toward heavy‑coverage: sketched expected heavy-collision bound E[# collisions] ≤ O(k1/R) under heavy/light separation R ≥ k^C via MRS supermartingale eH_t; ready for an optional‑stopping formalization.

Lower‑bound direction outlined: propose constructing OPT(·) with Δ(k)=1 for 1−o(1) fraction (tiny multiplicative OPT drops) to obtain an Ω(log k0) lower bound; needs a concrete radii schedule and verification.
next_questions: Rigorously prove the expected‑collision micro‑lemma: pin down the required scale‑separation exponent C and a light‑mass bound, then apply optional stopping to the MRS supermartingale eH_t to convert the O(k1/R) expectation into a high‑probability bound (P[any heavy collision] ≤ R^{−Ω(1)}).

Incorporate the Hybrid plateau‑average lemma and the monotonicity remark into output.md with explicit numeric constants (e.g., C_bi=C_fix=5), and optimize the split parameter τ to tighten constants — provide a closed‑form upper bound for the optimized τ.

Construct and test a formal worst‑case OPT(·) profile (or rule it out): produce a concrete radii/schedule achieving Δ(k)=1 for most k to settle whether an Ω(log k0) lower bound is attainable; validate the hybrid/global bounds numerically on such profiles.
